page.title: 13Farming In The Notgrove Area
page.content: 3 Farms have land in the block, the Notgrove Estate, the Salperton Estate and Westfield Farm. The Notgrove Estate comprises 1500 acres of which 900 are arable. There are 1000 sheep, and 400 cattle both intensive beef and a dairy herd of Friesans. The milk is collected by bulk tanker to be processed by the Milk Marketing Board. A mixture of wheat and barley, both spring and winter are grown. Kale is grown for winter feed. Pheasants are reared for winter shoots, and 6 Hunter horses are kept for Fox hunting. A little of the Salperton Estate is in the South West corner of the area it is of a similar acreage to the Notgrove Estate with a similar range of crops plus Oil Seed Rape.
